Rulings.Base:
1. This effect targets the face-up monster you control.
2. You refer to the target's current Level on the field when this effect resolves.
3. If the target is no longer face-up on the field when this effect resolves, you don't Special Summon a monster.
4. If your opponent takes control of the target before this effect resolves, you still Special Summon a monster.
5. You refer to the current Level of the monster in your hand when you resolve this effect, including all modifications from cards like "Cost Down".
6. If there is no longer a monster in your hand that you can Special Summon when this effect resolves, your opponent may briefly verify that this is the case.
